Looks like Kopernicus just put out an update with a new way to make reparenting Kerbin work. Should be a huge boon to New Horizons, especially after 1.2 made the bugs with the old reparenting method worse. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Watching this with a lot of interest. I remember playing with new horizons a few versions ago, and I'm looking forward to visiting it again in 1.2! Might do a industrial career with virtually all funding from selling resources instead of contracts.

I can't load this mod at all. When I try to use it I end up with the stock system. I'm only using this mod and Kopernicus at KSP version 1.1.0

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-28T23:38:44Z" title="10/28/2016 11:38  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 28, 2016</time> by Lemcal Kerman**
  
typo

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Lemcal Kerman said:
> 
> 
> I'm only using this mod and Kopernicus at KSP version 1.1.0
> 

Which version of Kopernicus? Which version of New Horizons?  

Kopernicus disables itself if run in a version of KSP it wasn't built for. At least, it did for the versions you're talking about. Example: Kopernicus 1.0.3 was the first version built for KSP 1.1.2, so running that version (or later) of Kopernicus in KSP 1.1.0 will not work. I'm not sure where you can find a KSP 1.1.2 version, but the latest version of NH (v2.0) was built for the (coincidentally numbered) version 1.1.2 of Kopernicus running in KSP 1.1.2.
![its_coming.jpg](https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-phN1pDpq4pk/VAs3_cCf1bI/AAAAAAAAAn4/CI5Q-hdI6VA/s1600/its_coming.jpg)
*\*stealthily positions a spy satellite over [@KillAshley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/128696-killashley/)'s home...\**

*\*quietly studying the data coming of the spy sattelite...\** 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-12-03T21:41:43Z" title="12/03/2016 09:41  PM" data-short="7 yr">December 3, 2016</time> by Epicdreamer**
Hey now, citizen! This is classified government data! Get out of here before I'll have you arrested for... ummm... undue excitement!
Are any new planets or moons coming for the new update? Perhaps a reimplementation of Lave?

Does this mod have custom ribbons for [Final Frontier](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/61065-12-final-frontier-kerbal-individual-merits-125-2906/)? If not, how much effort would it take to implement? I'd be willing to try, but I can't seem to find a wiki/tutorial about this. Does anyone know how to get started/where to find help about this?

I didn't play much KSP when 2.0 of New Horizons came out, I really liked the earlier versions looking forward to trying out the latest version.

Thanks for creating it.

It's Coming!!!! This mod is what gave me thought into what if earth were in orbit around a Saturn-like Gas giant. Can't wait for the next edition of this mod.

You rule [@KillAshley](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/128696-killashley/)! You have always been my favourite Custom Kerbol System creator.

is it updated for 1.2?

looking really nice

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Jebadiah Kerban said:
> 
> 
> is it updated for 1.2?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> looking really nice
> 

Not officially, but it will still work in 1.2 as long as you have the latest version of Kopernicus (using it in 1.2 right now). 

But while the planet pack is still playable, it has some drawbacks but nothing too game breaking. For one, trying to apply Scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> configs won't work until it is updated to 1.2, and there is a bug where all you see is a void when you're in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> overview (although forum user [@ayli](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/162642-ayli/) posted a config in the thread above that fixes this issue).
i am getting ultra ready to play this mod again ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Wow, KSP has changed. All these new menu options and settings, 64-bit native support! The thing that really surprised me was how much New Horizons has changed though, I didn't expect much more than texture and terrain changes with the improvement of Kopernicus. I dusted off my old game and can't really see myself continuing it, NH today isn't the same as 15 months ago. I do have over 100 hours of footage though and I might as well finish what I started (in some sense at least)! I may see how successful I am at getting a sept 2015 version of NH and Kopernius running in a 12/26/16 newly modded version of current KSP haha.

Welp, KSP just ate my current save game so i think I shall wait for NH to update and then start again when it does!

> 
> 
> Just now, Malich said:
> 
> 
> Welp, KSP just ate my current save game so i think I shall wait for NH to update and then start again when it does!
> 

First rule of modding: always back up your saves.

I'm not sure why that's not so commonly known here, I used to install Minecraft mods back when I still played that, and every mod I downloaded had it posted in a font size of at least 70: "WHATEVER YOU DO, **ALWAYS** BACK UP YOUR SAVES"

If I may ask, how did KSP 'eat' your current save game?
